title: Multistep Form. Made with Vanilla JS, SCSS and BEM notation.
description: This multistep form project demonstrates a clean, interactive way to gather user information across multiple steps. Built entirely with Vanilla JS, SCSS, and following BEM notation, the form transitions smoothly between steps, validating input along the way. This project highlights skills in DOM manipulation, responsive design, and modular CSS architecture, making it ideal for practicing structured front-end development and creating user-friendly interfaces for real-world applications.

title: Ecommerce Product Page, Using BEM, SCSS and Vanilla JS.
description: This ecommerce product page focuses on showcasing a single product with interactive features like image galleries, quantity selection, and a cart system. Implemented with Vanilla JS, SCSS, and BEM methodology, the project emphasizes clean code, responsive layouts, and accessibility. It is designed to mimic a professional product page experience while giving hands-on practice with UI interactivity and front-end architecture, useful for portfolio demonstrations or real ecommerce implementations.

title: Job listing app, using SCSS, BEM and Vanilla JS.
description: This job listing app allows users to filter and explore various job opportunities using multiple tags. Built with Vanilla JS, SCSS, and BEM notation, it demonstrates dynamic DOM manipulation and state management without external libraries. The project emphasizes user interaction design, responsive layouts, and the practical use of structured CSS, providing a hands-on example of building functional front-end applications that resemble real job boards.

title: Countries API, added pagination. Wrote using BEM, SCSS and Vanilla JS.
description: This project interacts with a public REST Countries API to display country information in a paginated interface. It highlights skills in API consumption, dynamic content rendering, and efficient front-end design. Built using Vanilla JS, SCSS, and following BEM, the app ensures a responsive, visually clean experience and reinforces best practices in modular CSS and structured JavaScript for beginners and intermediate developers.

title: Comments Section Vanilla JS, SCSS and BEM Notation.
description: This interactive comments section allows users to post, edit, and reply to comments dynamically. Built entirely with Vanilla JS, SCSS, and BEM notation, the project demonstrates practical application of DOM manipulation, component structure, and responsive design. It’s a great showcase of front-end skills for user interaction management, state updates, and maintaining clean, scalable CSS architecture for complex UI components.

title: Calculator App, Grid, Vanilla JS, SCSS and BEM, Also Responsive.
description: This calculator app provides a fully functional, responsive interface for basic arithmetic operations. Using Vanilla JS, SCSS, and BEM methodology, it highlights event handling, grid layout implementation, and modular CSS practices. Designed for both desktop and mobile screens, it’s an excellent project for learning structured front-end development and creating a clean, interactive utility that showcases programming fundamentals in a practical context.

title: Product Cart With List Using SCSS and BEM Notation
description: This project implements a product listing page with an interactive cart system. Users can add and remove items, and see a real-time update of the cart contents. Built with Vanilla JS, SCSS, and BEM notation, it focuses on clean code structure, modular styling, and DOM manipulation skills. The app demonstrates essential e-commerce interactions and a responsive layout suitable for both desktop and mobile users.

title: To Do App

It’s ideal for demonstrating front-end capabilities, user experience considerations, and modular code architecture, making it a solid example of building functional productivity tools.

title: Contact form
